ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
1. Creative tools to be used in staging theatrical scenes.
2. Creative activities to be done with students.

I have learned about not only directing skills and theatrical methods such as text analysis, stage design, and stage management, but also how to build a healthy and welcoming cooperation environment which will be really helpful for me for the rest of my life.

So much to explain. One of the best skills I obtained from this course was the practical directing practice we received. Being able to direct my peers was the best use of my time. Also, learning how to dissect a play was great as well.

This course truly helped me to shift my focus from thinking as a performer (focusing on one objective at a time) to thinking of the production as a whole. It helped me expand out of what's comfortable and safe and reminded me that taking risks and making mistakes are still an important part of the process.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: content, facilitators, venues

Weaknesses: scheduling but this I think is subjective because you can't please everyone. It's possible that the schedule was best. Instinctively I want to suggest having the program be 12 days as opposed to 10 and making classes 2 hrs long as opposed to 3 and making the breaks (1 hrs long - which was actually done during the program I guess because it was asked). However, maybe in reality, it's fine as is.

Strengths: It has quite abundant content that almost involves all areas of theatre work, and it tells me how to be a good person which, in my opinion, is much more important than technical skills. The teachers did not push me so hard, instead, they gave me time and space to adjust everything here which made me feel pleasant and comfortable.
Weakness: At the first couple of days, the break time between two classes was kind of embarrassed, but after it changed to 1.5 hours, it became more reasonable

The strengths are definitely the transparency, the care regarding our overall mental capabilities and the schedule. Although the schedule was tough, I felt that it was a great balance. The only weakness was the housing unit we were originally placed within. We should've been placed within a dorm that had air circulating.
It was wonderful to know that the leadership team was reading the daily evaluations and addressing them/making adjustments each and everyday to enhance the overall experience of the course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely, because it truly was a great experience. Very therapeutic in some ways...

Yes.
 For me, this course broadened my horizon from multiple perspectives, and it has a comfortable atmosphere in classes, allowing all students to learn and absorb knowledge in their own ways. And it also provides diverse activities of creating, cooperating, thinking and sharing.
Absolutely. This course was amazing. I learned tremendous amounts of things that I have not learned while holding masters degree in theatre arts.

I would absolutely recommend this course to another! What's especially wonderful was knowing that this course continues to grow and evolve as the needs of the theatre community changes and evolves as well.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I will apply several tools in preparation for productions at my High School.

I will certainly need some time to taste and experience those theories and methods, and I will combine them with the culture in my country to do all my best to improve the working environment where I am.
I want to becoming a full time director. So, these skills will definitely come in handy for me.

I'm already tapped to lead a discussion on equitable theatre practices and maintaining a collaborative rehearsal room. I feel confident leading this workshop and will certainly use the many notes I took as a reference for my session!
